workflow.name: Generate viral Facebook posts with Gemini 2.0 & AI image generation
workflow.description:
# üöÄ AI Facebook Post Generator - Complete Setup Guide

> Transform your content ideas into viral Facebook posts with AI-powered automation in just 30 minutes!

---

## üìã Prerequisites Checklist

**What you'll need before we start:**

- ‚úÖ n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted)
- ‚úÖ Facebook Business Page (*not personal profile*)
- ‚úÖ Google account with Sheets & Gmail access
- ‚úÖ Basic understanding of API credentials

**‚è±Ô∏è Estimated Setup Time:** 30-45 minutes  
**üéØ Difficulty Level:** Intermediate  
**üí∞ Cost:** Free tier available for all services

---

## üé® What You'll Build

By the end of this guide, you'll have:

- üìù **Smart Content Form** - Web form that captures your ideas
- ü§ñ **AI Content Optimizer** - Gemini AI that polishes your writing
- üñºÔ∏è **Auto Image Generator** - Custom visuals created automatically
- üìä **Content Tracker** - Google Sheets logging for analytics
- üì± **Facebook Publisher** - Direct posting to your page
- üìß **Success Notifications** - Email confirmations with post links

---

# üîß Step-by-Step Setup

## Step 1: üìò Facebook Integration Setup

### üî∏ 1.1 Create Your Facebook App

**Why this matters:** This gives your workflow permission to post on your behalf.

1. Navigate to [Facebook Developers](https://developers.facebook.com/) üåê
2. Click **"My Apps"** ‚Üí **"Create App"**
3. Select **"Business"** as your app type
4. **App Name:** `AI-Content-Poster` *(or your preferred name)*
5. Hit **"Create App"**

> üí° **Pro Tip:** Choose a descriptive name - you'll see this in your Facebook activity logs

### üî∏ 1.2 Configure App Settings

1. In your app dashboard: **"Add a Product"**
2. Find **"Facebook Login"** ‚Üí **"Set Up"**
3. Navigate to **Settings** ‚Üí **Basic**
4. **App Domains:** Add `app.n8n.cloud` *(for n8n cloud users)*
5. **Save changes** ‚úÖ

### üî∏ 1.3 Generate Your Page Access Token

**This is the key that unlocks posting powers! üîë**

1. Go to **Tools** ‚Üí **Graph API Explorer**
2. Select your newly created app
3. Click **"Generate Access Token"**
4. **Required Permissions:** 
   - `pages_manage_posts`
   - `pages_read_engagement`
   - `pages_show_list`
5. Select your target Facebook page
6. **Copy the token** *(starts with `EAAG...`)*

‚ö†Ô∏è **Critical Step - Make Token Long-Lived:**
- In Graph API Explorer, make a GET request to:
```
/oauth/access_token?grant_type=fb_exchange_token&client_id=YOUR_APP_ID&client_secret=YOUR_APP_SECRET&fb_exchange_token=YOUR_SHORT_TOKEN
```

### üî∏ 1.4 Find Your Page ID

**Two methods to get your Page ID:**

**Method 1 - Direct from Facebook:**
1. Visit your Facebook page
2. Click **"About"** tab
3. Scroll to find **"Page ID"**

**Method 2 - API Explorer:**
1. Use Graph API Explorer
2. GET request to: `/me/accounts`
3. Find your page in the response

---

## Step 2: üîç Google Services Setup

### üî∏ 2.1 Enable Required APIs

**Setting up your Google Cloud foundation:**

1. Visit [Google Cloud Console](https://console.cloud.google.com/) ‚òÅÔ∏è
2. **Create new project** or select existing
3. **"APIs & Services"** ‚Üí **"Library"**
4. **Enable these APIs:**
   - ‚úÖ Google Sheets API
   - ‚úÖ Gmail API  
   - ‚úÖ Google Drive API *(optional)*

### üî∏ 2.2 Create Service Account

**This creates a "robot" account for automated access:**

1. **"APIs & Services"** ‚Üí **"Credentials"**
2. **"Create Credentials"** ‚Üí **"Service Account"**
3. **Name:** `ai-facebook-automation`
4. **"Create and Continue"**
5. Skip role assignment ‚Üí **"Continue"**
6. **"Done"** ‚úÖ

### üî∏ 2.3 Download Credentials File

1. Click your service account email
2. **"Keys"** tab ‚Üí **"Add Key"** ‚Üí **"Create New Key"**
3. Choose **"JSON"** format
4. **Download and save securely** üìÅ

> üîí **Security Note:** This file contains sensitive credentials. Store it safely!

### üî∏ 2.4 Prepare Your Google Sheets

**Create your data tracking system:**

**üìä Sheet 1: Content Log**
- **Purpose:** Track all generated content
- **Columns:**
  - A: Date *(Ng√†y)*
  - B: Short Content *(N·ªôi dung ng·∫Øn)*  
  - C: Full Content *(N·ªôi dung ƒë·∫ßy ƒë·ªß)*

**üìù Sheet 2: Input Tracking**
- **Purpose:** Log form submissions
- **Columns:**
  - A: Date
  - B: Time
  - C: Content

**üîó Important:** Share both sheets with your service account email *(found in the JSON file)*

---

## Step 3: ü§ñ AI Services Configuration

### üî∏ 3.1 Get Your Gemini API Key

**Power up your AI content generation:**

1. Head to [Google AI Studio](https://makersuite.google.com/app/apikey) üé®
2. Sign in with Google account
3. **"Create API Key"**
4. **Copy the key** *(starts with `AIza...`)*

> üí∞ **Cost Info:** Gemini offers generous free tier limits - perfect for getting started!

---

## Step 4: ‚öôÔ∏è n8n Workflow Configuration

### üî∏ 4.1 Import the Magic ‚ú®

1. **Copy the workflow JSON** from the template
2. In n8n: **"Import from JSON"**
3. **Paste** the workflow code
4. **"Import"** to load your new automation

### üî∏ 4.2 Configure Your Credentials

**üîë Facebook Graph API Setup:**
1. **Settings** ‚Üí **Credentials** ‚Üí **"Add Credential"**
2. Search: **"Facebook Graph API"**
3. **Access Token:** Your Page Access Token from Step 1.3
4. **Test connection** ‚Üí **Save as:** `Facebook Page Access`

**üîç Google Services Setup:**
1. **"Add Credential"** ‚Üí **"Google Service Account"**
2. **Upload your JSON file** from Step 2.3
3. **Test connection** ‚Üí **Save as:** `Google Services`

**üß† Gemini AI Setup:**
1. **"Add Credential"** ‚Üí **"Google PaLM API"**
2. **Enter your Gemini key** from Step 3.1
3. **Save as:** `Gemini AI`

### üî∏ 4.3 Customize Node Settings

**üì± Update Facebook Configuration:**

**In "Facebook Graph API" node:**
- Replace `"113732581629527"` with **your Page ID** from Step 1.4

**In "Facebook Upload Img" node:**
- Replace `"113732581629527"` with **your Page ID** from Step 1.4

**üìä Update Google Sheets:**

**In "save content" node:**
- Replace Document ID with your **Content Log Sheet ID**

**In "Append row in sheet" node:**
- Replace Document ID with your **Input Tracking Sheet ID**

> üí° **Finding Sheet ID:** It's the long string in your Google Sheets URL after `/spreadsheets/d/`

**üìß Update Notification Email:**

**In "Send a message" node:**
- Replace `xxx@gmail.com` with **your email address**
- Configure Gmail credentials

---

## Step 5: üß™ Testing & Validation

### üî∏ 5.1 Component Testing

**üìä Test Google Sheets Connection:**
1. Right-click **"Append row in sheet"** node
2. **"Execute Node"**
3. ‚úÖ Verify test row appears in your sheet

**ü§ñ Test Gemini AI:**
1. Right-click **"Basic LLM Chain"** node
2. **"Edit Input Data"** ‚Üí Add test content
3. **Execute** ‚Üí ‚úÖ Verify AI response quality

**üñºÔ∏è Test Image Generation:**
1. Right-click **"HTTP Request"** node
2. Ensure valid prompt from previous step
3. **Execute** ‚Üí ‚úÖ Check for base64 image data

**üì± Test Facebook Upload:**
1. Run full workflow with test content
2. ‚úÖ Check your Facebook page for new post
3. ‚úÖ Verify image uploaded correctly

### üî∏ 5.2 End-to-End Victory Test üéâ

1. **"Execute Workflow"** on trigger node
2. **Submit test content** through the form
3. **Monitor each node** execution
4. **üéä Celebrate your first AI-generated post!**

---

## üéØ Success Indicators

**Your setup is complete when you see:**

- ‚úÖ Form accepts and processes content
- ‚úÖ AI generates optimized text + image prompt  
- ‚úÖ Custom image appears in Facebook post
- ‚úÖ Content logged in Google Sheets
- ‚úÖ Success email in your inbox
- ‚úÖ Professional-looking post on your Facebook page

---

## üö® Troubleshooting Quick Fixes

### Facebook Issues
- **Token Expired?** ‚Üí Generate new long-lived token
- **Permission Denied?** ‚Üí Check page admin rights
- **Invalid Page ID?** ‚Üí Double-check Page ID format

### Google Sheets Problems  
- **403 Forbidden?** ‚Üí Share sheet with service account
- **Sheet Not Found?** ‚Üí Verify Sheet ID in URL
- **Column Errors?** ‚Üí Match exact column names

### AI Content Issues
- **Empty Responses?** ‚Üí Check Gemini API quotas
- **Poor Quality?** ‚Üí Adjust AI prompts
- **JSON Errors?** ‚Üí Validate parsing logic

---

## üé® Customization Ideas

**Make it uniquely yours:**

- üé® **Brand Voice:** Adjust AI prompts for your tone
- ‚è∞ **Scheduling:** Add time delays for strategic posting
- üìà **Analytics:** Connect performance tracking tools
- üîÑ **Multi-Platform:** Extend to Instagram, LinkedIn
- üë• **Team Features:** Add approval workflows

---

## üéâ You Did It!

**Congratulations! You've built an AI-powered content machine that will save you hours every week.**

**What's Next?**
- Test with different content types
- Monitor performance in Google Sheets
- Refine AI prompts for better results
- Share your success with the community!

**Need Help?** ü§ù
- Join [n8n Discord](https://discord.com/invite/XPKeKXeB7d)
- Visit [Community Forum](https://community.n8n.io/)
- Check [n8n Documentation](https://docs.n8n.io/)

---

*Ready to revolutionize your content creation? Your AI assistant is waiting! üöÄ*

parameters.text:
=You are a marketing content writer. Here is the input content. Do 3 things:

1. Quickly analyze the content.

2. Bullet out the main points to write the article (content marketing or social media post).

3. Return the correct format requested, **no further explanation**, **no additional paragraphs other than the following JSON**.

Return the result in the following format:
{
"prompt_image": "...",
"content": "..."
}

---
"prompt_image": [write a prompt to create an AI image that matches the content, note: absolutely do not put text in the image, only describe the image and appropriate design style]

"content": [write complete, clear, concise, and focused content that can be posted on Facebook, website, or blog]

Content to be processed:
""
{{
$json.message?.text?.trim()
? $json.message.text
: $json.content?.trim()
? $json.content
: $json['Content']?.trim()
? $json['Content']
: ""
}}
"""

=You are a social media content writer. Here is a summary of the content that has been analyzed by AI. Let's turn it into **a complete article**, with the following requirements:

1. **Keep the spirit and main message of the content intact.**
2. Rewrite it into a coherent article, with a clear introduction - body - conclusion.
3. Use a **friendly, approachable tone**, easy to understand, suitable for posting on Facebook
4. Use emojis sparingly to increase attraction (if appropriate).
5. Keep the length moderate (from 200‚Äì350 words).
6. **Do not insert titles or #hashtags**, just focus on the main content.

Here is the summary:
""
{{ $json.content }}
"""

parameters.formDescription: Input the idea that you want upload to Facebook,

parameters.message:
=‚úÖ The post will be published after 2 minutes!
üìÑ Review in: https://facebook.com/{{ $json.id.split('_')[0] }}/posts/{{ $json.id.split('_')[1] }}
parameters.subject: ‚úÖ The draft version is uploaded

parameters.content:
# Complete Setup Guide: AI Facebook Post Generator

## Prerequisites Checklist

Before starting, ensure you have:
- [ ] n8n instance (cloud or self-hosted)
- [ ] Facebook Business Page (not personal profile)
- [ ] Google account with access to Sheets and Gmail
- [ ] Basic understanding of API credentials

**Estimated Setup Time**: 30-45 minutes

---

## Step 1: Facebook Integration Setup

### 1.1 Create Facebook App
1. Go to [Facebook Developers](https://developers.facebook.com/)
2. Click **"My Apps"** ‚Üí **"Create App"**
3. Choose **"Business"** as app type
4. Enter app name: `n8n-facebook-poster` (or your preferred name)
5. Click **"Create App"**

### 1.2 Configure Facebook App
1. In your app dashboard, go to **"Add a Product"**
2. Find **"Facebook Login"** and click **"Set Up"**
3. Go to **Settings** ‚Üí **Basic**
4. Add your domain to **"App Domains"** (for n8n cloud: `app.n8n.cloud`)
5. Save changes

### 1.3 Get Page Access Token
1. Go to **Tools** ‚Üí **Graph API Explorer**
2. Select your app from the dropdown
3. Click **"Generate Access Token"**
4. Grant permissions: `pages_manage_posts`, `pages_read_engagement`, `pages_show_list`
5. Select your Facebook page
6. Copy the **Page Access Token** (starts with `EAAG...`)
7. **Important**: Extend token to long-lived:
   - Use Graph API Explorer
   - Make GET request to: `/oauth/access_token?grant_type=fb_exchange_token&client_id=YOUR_APP_ID&client_secret=YOUR_APP_SECRET&fb_exchange_token=YOUR_SHORT_TOKEN`

### 1.4 Get Your Page ID
1. Go to your Facebook page
2. Click **"About"** tab
3. Scroll down to find **"Page ID"** or
4. Use Graph API Explorer: GET request to `/me/accounts` with your token

---

## Step 2: Google Services Setup

### 2.1 Enable Google APIs
1. Go to [Google Cloud Console](https://console.cloud.google.com/)
2. Create new project or select existing one
3. Go to **"APIs & Services"** ‚Üí **"Library"**
4. Enable these APIs:
   - Google Sheets API
   - Gmail API
   - Google Drive API (optional)

### 2.2 Create Service Account
1. Go to **"APIs & Services"** ‚Üí **"Credentials"**
2. Click **"Create Credentials"** ‚Üí **"Service Account"**
3. Name: `n8n-facebook-automation`
4. Click **"Create and Continue"**
5. Skip role assignment (click **"Continue"**)
6. Click **"Done"**

### 2.3 Generate Service Account Key
1. Click on your service account email
2. Go to **"Keys"** tab
3. Click **"Add Key"** ‚Üí **"Create New Key"**
4. Choose **"JSON"** format
5. Download the JSON file (save securely)

### 2.4 Prepare Google Sheets
1. Create two Google Sheets:
   - **Content Log Sheet**: For tracking generated content
   - **Input Tracking Sheet**: For logging form submissions

2. **Content Log Sheet Structure**:
   - Column A: (Date)
   - Column B: (Short Content)
   - Column C: (Full Content)

3. **Input Tracking Sheet Structure**:
   - Column A: "Date"
   - Column B: "Time"
   - Column C: "Content"

4. Share both sheets with your service account email (found in the JSON file)

---

## Step 3: AI Services Setup

### Get Gemini API Key
1. Go to [Google AI Studio](https://makersuite.google.com/app/apikey)
2. Sign in with your Google account
3. Click **"Create API Key"**
4. Copy the API key (starts with `AIza...`)
---

## Step 4: n8n Configuration

### 4.1 Import the Workflow
1. Copy the workflow JSON from the template
2. In n8n, click **"Import from JSON"**
3. Paste the workflow JSON
4. Click **"Import"**

### 4.2 Configure Credentials

#### Facebook Graph API Credentials
1. Go to **Settings** ‚Üí **Credentials**
2. Click **"Add Credential"**
3. Search for **"Facebook Graph API"**
4. Enter:
   - **Access Token**: Your Page Access Token from Step 1.3
5. Test the connection
6. Save as: `Facebook Page Access`

#### Google Credentials  
1. Add **"Google Service Account"** credential
2. Upload the JSON file from Step 2.3
3. Test connection
4. Save as: `Google Services`

#### Gemini API Credentials
1. Add **"Google PaLM API"** credential
2. Enter your Gemini API key from Step 3.1
3. Save as: `Gemini AI`

### 4.3 Update Node Configurations

#### Update Facebook Page ID
1. Open **"Facebook Graph API"** node
2. Replace `"113732581629527"` with your actual Page ID from Step 1.4
3. Do the same for **"Facebook Upload Img"** node

#### Update Google Sheets IDs
1. Open **"save content"** node
2. Replace the Document ID with your Content Log Sheet ID
3. Open **"Append row in sheet"** node  
4. Replace the Document ID with your Input Tracking Sheet ID

**To find Sheet ID**: Look at the URL - it's the long string after `/spreadsheets/d/`

#### Update Email Address
1. Open **"Send a message"** node
2. Replace `xxx@gmail.com` with your email
3. Configure Gmail credentials if not already done

---

## Step 5: Testing & Validation

### 5.1 Test Individual Components

#### Test Google Sheets Connection
1. Right-click **"Append row in sheet"** node
2. Click **"Execute Node"**
3. Check if a test row appears in your sheet

#### Test Gemini AI
1. Right-click **"Basic LLM Chain"** node
2. Add test data in **"Edit Input Data"**
3. Execute and verify AI response

#### Test Image Generation
1. Right-click **"HTTP Request"** node
2. Ensure it has a valid prompt from previous step
3. Execute and check for base64 image data

#### Test Facebook Upload
1. Run the full workflow with test content
2. Check your Facebook page for the post
3. Verify image uploaded correctly

### 5.2 End-to-End Test
1. Click **"Execute Workflow"** on the trigger node
2. Submit test content through the form
3. Monitor each node's execution
4. Verify final Facebook post

user.name: Charles
user.bio: I'm a Freelance AI Automation Engineer, helping Sales & Marketing teams streamline their workflows with custom n8n automations. With 5+ years of experience, I‚Äôve helped hundreds of businesses adopt AI-powered solutions using n8n ‚úÖ Free consultation available ‚Äî book now and start saving time: üëâ https://www.aivra.work/en

data.details: The Function node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow. Unlike the Function Item node, this node does not operate on incoming node data per-item. Instead, you must iterate over multiple items of incoming data yourself. This can be useful if you're performing data transformation where you want to manipulate the number of items being outputted by the node (i.e. 1 item is inputted in with nested object, 10 items are outputted without any nested objects)

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
